title: L'Apothiquaire Spa - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Photos)
cleaned_text: original L'Apothiquaire branch is ideally situated in the heart of downtown, close to the main hotels and offering the perfect urban sanctuary and spa. Housed in a quaint, lovingly restored century-old French townhouse. L'Apothiquaire features high ceilings, original tiling, an exposed brick wall and wooden stairs. The antique furniture enhances the old world charm which transports you away from the hectic pace of modernity. Upon entering, L'Apothiquaire is a boutique with traditional wooden cabinets - resembling a 17th century French Apothecary. Along the cabinets is an array of the comprehensive range of L'Apothiquaire's beautifully packaged organic body and face oils, scrubs, bath salts, organic soaps and organic herbal blends, from France. An intimate foot-care room overlooks a small courtyard featuring a gargoyle and orchids. Upstairs are seven private & semi-private treatment rooms draped with luxurious, velvet curtains. An elegant suite featuring a private Jacuzzi. Treatments follow the L'Apothiquaire philosophy of using only the finest, natural and organic ingredients to offer a delicate but effective healing process for mind and body. Trained beauty consultants will put you at ease, tailor a treatment to suit your individual needs and recommend an going program to ensure your renewed radiance is maintained. L'Apothiquaire Artisan Beaute opened in 2005 and was voted 'Best Beauty Salon' in the same year. It offers the ultimate in body care and facials, a unique experience not to be missed. Suggested duration 2-3 hours Suggest edits to improve what we show. Nov 2019 Solo The atmosphere of the place and greeting of staff were very nice. I've done jacuzzi soak, body scrub and massage - everything was done very well. Therapist was very professional and did a great work. I was completely happy and relaxed, and proceeded for a lunch before my last treatment- hair wash and blow-dry. This service is described in the menu as "Our stylists are there to provide quality shampoo and blow dry to give you the style you request". I had a meeting after the SPA, so was thinking it's gonna be nice to have my blow-dry done. Here the worst part starts. The "stylist" who suppose to "give me the style I request" simply doesn't know how to dry the hair at all! She started just to dry it in a messy way without using the brush, showing that she does it may be for the first time in her life. When I asked about a proper blow-dry, her colleague said that salon can't provide a blow dry because they haven't got any brushes! However, in the end, "stylist" found a plenty of brushes, but better she wouldn't! That was definitely her first time to hold the brash! She messed all my hair up! I took the dryer from her and simply dried it myself, just couldn't wait to leave and to go to a proper hair salon to fix this mess! Forget about using this service, if you feel pity for your hair!!! No need to say that my mood was completely ruined. When I went down and complained, the lady on reception (her name is Tracey) was like "Our salon is focused on SPA, not on beauty services". Definitely! But here I asked "Why do you even provide these services then and charging people for something you can not even make?" Here she again said the same which pissed me off completely! I've spent over 2 000 000 for treatments that day, but why do I need to pay a single dollar for someone to waste my time, mess up my hair and being unprofessional?! Dear management, if you are reading this, kindly give your therapists a proper training to be able to provide a beauty services (as there is no any "hair stylist" that was mentioned in your menu, it doesn't exist, service was done by therapist who doesn't know how to carry a hair dryer!), or simply exclude this service from your menu, as you are unable to provide it and have no right to offer it! However, one of the staff member, Jane, came upon my leaving and apologized and offered to return half of the price of this "blow dry", and she was extremely polite. It was my mistake to order this service, which ruined my impression of an amazing SPA day, great treatments and massages. Again, I feel sorry that you add this service to your menu with such a nice description - gives a very bad aftertaste... Sep 2019 Usually when we're in HCM City, a massage is a must but it's usually a whirlwind affair. in L'Apothiquaire Spa, you should spend at least half a day pampering yourself. I felt that it was an unrushed affair with staff ushering you to the different rooms. The only discomfort is that the changing room is next to the service alley and as you're changing you hear the door opening and closing although your privacy is protected by heavy curtain. I managed to have a body massage, mani and pedi as well as facial within this 4-hour retreat. The other plus point is that the spa is housed within a colonial bungalow so you feel that you're experiencing the heritage as well.
